metadata.title: CVE-2021-47610 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/msm: Fix null ptr access msm_ioctl_gem_submit() Fix the below nullpointer dereference in msm_ioctl_gem_submit(): 26545.260705: Call trace:26545.263223: kref_put+0x1c/0x60 26545.266452:msm_ioctl_gem_submit+0x254/0x744 26545.270937: drm_ioctl_kernel+0xa8/0x12426545.274976: drm_ioctl+0x21c/0x33c 26545.278478:drm_compat_ioctl+0xdc/0xf0 26545.282428:__arm64_compat_sys_ioctl+0xc8/0x100 26545.287169: el0_svc_common+0xf8/0x25026545.291025: do_el0_svc_compat+0x28/0x54 26545.295066:el0_svc_compat+0x10/0x1c 26545.298838: el0_sync_compat_handler+0xa8/0xcc26545.303403: el0_sync_compat+0x188/0x1c0 26545.307445: Code: d503201fd503201f 52800028 4b0803e8 (b8680008) 26545.318799: Kernel panic - notsyncing: Oops: Fatal exception

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47610` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-37-generic - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-37-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-37-lowlatency - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-37-lowlatency - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-kvm - 4.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-16.19').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1').
